english: I told you he was different.
I want to hear it again.
It’s the same thing every week.
But what can he do for us?
ghor: tyʁ mad vyl naʃ lo ma
script: Tur made vule nache lo mah

english: We won’t know until we ask.
If he just answers questions, he’s worth it.
We have to run this down.
Let’s do it quickly before he’s replaced.
ghor: naʃ mad zip afi lo bʁɛd
script: Nache made zippe afi lo braid

english: I’m the broker for a webberie co-op in the Beldoni Valley.
ghor: mo dimaʁklɛʒ va kodɑ̃s sin bɛ̃doli valɛn
script: Mo dimarclège va codance sin Bendoli Va-leine.

english: …some have been in business almost a millenium.
which they changed again last night
for the first time in their history
are wondering if it’s even worth it to open the hives next spring
ghor: pɔ̃dɛn djal deʁ smylɛ a ɡɛm velɔʁ kaʁa pøtiʃ pydjɛl
script: pondène dial dére semulè á gèmme velore cara peutiche pudiel

english: Put the boxes downwind from dust.
ghor: sak kɔfɛf bɔ̃ flo dɑn vɛt
script: Saque cofèfes bon floh dan vette.

english: You’ll be spitting all day long.
when we’re trying to sleep… when we try to forget
ghor: vla pɛnaʒ tynkɔʁ . vla pɛnaʒ tɔʁde
script: vla penage tuncor… vla penage torder

english: They’ll make a prison of Palmo before they’re done.
ghor: sim fo.ʒə.ʁo bi.lɛ dan pal.mo, a.fi sim mɛ̃.ty

english: …there would be no shadow cast from the new building onto the memorial
ghor: mu kum klɛʒ.ton dan maz ig.lõ tɛlʃ xɛm

english: They’re building an armoury in the centre of Palmo, and you know it.
ghor: i sim das.von sin pal.mo, ɛ da.lam vaʃ kʁo.g

english: That’s actually something we don’t know.
ghor: da.lam bi a un naʃ kʁog (kum?)

english: At this point we have nothing but rumours.
Karn’s prior record. We found him.
ghor: pɔʒi kʁilis dan kaʁn . naʃ lo kabɛ

english: We got this from a Preox-Morlana database.
ghor: lə bagɔ dan madevɔʁ pʁeɔks mɔʁlana

english: What was our friend Mr. Karn doing on Morlana One?
ghor: ɛ vyl ʃəmato kaʁn pɛl mɔʁlana wan

english: He was there for five years. He was a corporate cop.
ghor: lo fig bɛsɛv gɑ̃m bɔl — fig tʁɔf ɛtaʒã

english: Apparently his departure there was quite a scandal.
ghor: pɛʁsɛ lo saleʒɑ̃ də fig smak skalavy

english: He was fired by the ISB.
Fired by the ISB and sent packing with full dishonour.
ghor: ʃlypit dan ɛ-sa-ba ɛ ɡiɡɔ̃ bɛl ɡʁakonaz

english: That would explain a great deal, wouldn’t it?

ghor: vyla bi dalam — vyla bi ma-sa-aʁ

english: It means the drivers need special clearance.
Let’s break it down and get the schedules first.
ghor: afi naʃ lə skɛbʁɛn ɛ boʁ pliɛ̃m

english: It’s a bit rough taking orders from strangers.
ghor: bi bumɛ ɡɛ̃ pɔ(ʁ) va ʁando

concord.English: a bit rough taking orders from strangers

english: Do you need help with the bags?
ghor: tɛm fiks a sɔʁ yn bylɡɛʃ

concord.English: do you need help with the bags?

english: Hey! Hello – slow down, slow down, …
You need to turn around and go home.
This isn’t for you. Just turn around and walk away. Walk away!
ghor: ɛ kum bi tem sɑ̃ pit sɛlmo binɔʁ skɛdadɔʁ . skɛdadɔʁ

english: Get the chob out of my way.

concord.English: get the chob out of my way

english: Just turn around and go home. Go home!
It had better be a toy.
Because if it isn’t, I’m going to stuff it down your ignorant little throat.
ghor: djal mo lã skafsjɔ̃ (?lobal/ʁobaʁ) katɔʁ tɛm fjɛfuskakɛt

concord.English: I’m going to stuff it down

english: You dare point that thing at me?!
(We need to go, they told us […])
ghor: naʃ mik balɔʁ . sim ʁo naʃ telpo

english: You were the one that started this.
ghor: te la pondɔʁ a niz dɔʁ madɛl bjombej (ø)

english: Pretending there is a chance is what’s stupid.
ghor: fontalɛsk bi mu kaʁ bi vul dikat

english: It’s the only thing that carries any dignity.
ghor: a laj fig brenaʃ bi sɛlmo poʃ fig ab sɛʁefos

english: We left dignity behind years ago.
ghor: naʃ fig skɛtan sɛʁɛfos a do gam. buliz

english: Should we stand and take it?
I’ve learned how good we are at letting them provoke us.
ghor: mo fig skube , nad bi bo nan sim naʃ godalo

concord.English: how good we are at letting them

english: You can’t keep screaming the same ideas expecting change.
ghor: viʁ kum tem bjed dop tikil su.kɛʁ to mas tek vaʃ

concord.English: keep screaming the same ideas expecting change
concord.Ghor: bjed dop tikil su.kɛʁ to mas tek vaʃ

english: Look what they’ve done to us.
… as if they’re in here laughing at us.
ghor: sø bi fɛ madal naʃ tʁombãnt

english: … you fight or lay rose petals in the street…
ghor: tem dabɔʁ sa lymz sin plaʒz

english: I don’t care for any of it.
If they take that from us…

ghor: mu kum kaz mala bliv madan

english: Attention! Curfew is now in effect!
ghor: da vonz ʃi pada bi madal

english: They’ve opened the plaza. We’re taking back the plaza.

ghor: u ni tʁi ʁo tʁaz (ʁul / vul?)
suə mik ʁɛn bi a bɔʁdu

english: They’ve been begging us to fight.
ghor: sim u fig naʃ ʁɛz dabɔʁ

english: We can’t stay silent any longer.
ghor: naʃ kum viɛʁ stan soʁɛft inɛks

english: We’ll be silent when we’re dead!
ghor: naʃ bi soʁɛft vla naʃ bi gastam

english: and show them who we are!
The only path is silent resist—
ghor: sɛn mog vi.naʃ bi ʃon pɛ—

english: Raise your eyes to homeland skies
ghor: oŋg dum ɛz va lavɛ glɛʒ

english: Breathe the air and know you’re there
Let me spend my every day there
ghor: dib mo laj mun laj sol lɛʒna

english: Call your kin to come and sing

ghor: vai bi gas e tʁɛm bi tʁa

english: Let me spend my every day there
ghor: dib mo laj mun laj sol lɛʒ.na

english: Tight the weave and roll the sleeve
Raise your eyes to homeland skies
Breathe the air and know you’re there
Let me spend my every day there
script: Dibe-mo laï moune laï sol lège-na

english: Call your kin to come and sing

script: Paipes bi ouämes sti kren mikammes

english: Tight the weave and roll the sleeve
Hear the horn, it’s here we’re born
Raise a cask and if they ask
script: Couffe tem stèr dial sim per

english: The words I knew we had to say
no light left on that pathway
One more daybreak – one more sunset – one more…
